en.av_c1: Suppose that you want to compute the sum of the values stored in a binary tree.
en.av_c2: You can ask two friends to help you.
en.av_c3: The first friend will take the left sub-tree to sum it.
en.av_c4: The second friend will take the right sub-tree to sum it
en.av_c5: The first friend will return the sum of  the left sub-tree
en.av_c6: The second friend will return the sum of  the left sub-tree
en.av_c7: All you need to do is sum the root value to the sums received from your friends.
en.av_c8: The intuition behind recursive methods is to trust that your friends (the helper method recursive calls) will return back to you the correct answer for what they do. Then, you just need to add what they tell you to the root value to get your final answer.
